14/*
15 * Define the interface from a DNS resolver to the Response Policy Zone
16 * library, librpz.
17 *
18 * This file should be included only the interface functions between the
19 * resolver and librpz to avoid name space pollution.
20 *
21 * Copyright (c) 2016-2017 Farsight Security, Inc.
22 *
23 * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
24 * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
25 * You may obtain a copy of the License at
26 * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
27 *
28 * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
29 * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
30 * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
31 * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
32 * limitations under the License.
33 *
34 * version 1.2.12
35 */
36
37#ifndef LIBRPZ_H
38#define LIBRPZ_H
39
40#include <inttypes.h>
41#include <stdbool.h>
42
43#include <arpa/nameser.h>
44#include <netinet/in.h>
45#include <stdarg.h>
46#include <stdbool.h>
47#include <stdio.h>
48#include <sys/types.h>
49
50
51/*
52 * Allow either ordinary or dlopen() linking.
53 */
54#ifdef LIBRPZ_INTERNAL
55#define LIBDEF(t,s) extern t s;
56#define LIBDEF_F(f) LIBDEF(librpz_##f##_t, librpz_##f)
57#else
58#define LIBDEF(t,s)
59#define LIBDEF_F(f)
60#endif
61
62/*
63 * Response Policy Zone triggers.
64 * Comparisons of trigger precedences require
65 * LIBRPZ_TRIG_CLIENT_IP < LIBRPZ_TRIG_QNAME < LIBRPZ_TRIG_IP
66 * < LIBRPZ_TRIG_NSDNAME < LIBRPZ_TRIG_NSIP}
67 */
68typedef enum {
69 LIBRPZ_TRIG_BAD =0,
70 LIBRPZ_TRIG_CLIENT_IP =1,
71 LIBRPZ_TRIG_QNAME =2,
72 LIBRPZ_TRIG_IP =3,
73 LIBRPZ_TRIG_NSDNAME =4,
74 LIBRPZ_TRIG_NSIP =5
75} librpz_trig_t;
76#define LIBRPZ_TRIG_SIZE 3 /* sizeof librpz_trig_t in bits */
77typedef uint8_t librpz_tbit_t; /* one bit for each of the TRIGS_NUM
78 * trigger types */
79
80
81/*
82 * Response Policy Zone Actions or policies
83 */
84typedef enum {
85 LIBRPZ_POLICY_UNDEFINED =0, /* an empty entry or no decision yet */
86 LIBRPZ_POLICY_DELETED =1, /* placeholder for a deleted policy */
87
88 LIBRPZ_POLICY_PASSTHRU =2, /* 'passthru': do not rewrite */
89 LIBRPZ_POLICY_DROP =3, /* 'drop': do not respond */
90 LIBRPZ_POLICY_TCP_ONLY =4, /* 'tcp-only': answer UDP with TC=1 */
91 LIBRPZ_POLICY_NXDOMAIN =5, /* 'nxdomain': answer with NXDOMAIN */
92 LIBRPZ_POLICY_NODATA =6, /* 'nodata': answer with ANCOUNT=0 */
93 LIBRPZ_POLICY_RECORD =7, /* rewrite with the policy's RR */
94
95 /* only in client configurations to override the zone */
96 LIBRPZ_POLICY_GIVEN, /* 'given': what policy record says */
97 LIBRPZ_POLICY_DISABLED, /* at most log */
98 LIBRPZ_POLICY_CNAME, /* answer with 'cname x' */
99} librpz_policy_t;
100#define LIBRPZ_POLICY_BITS 4
101
102/*
103 * Special policies that appear as targets of CNAMEs
104 * NXDOMAIN is signaled by a CNAME with a "." target.
105 * NODATA is signaled by a CNAME with a "*." target.
106 */
107#define LIBRPZ_RPZ_PREFIX "rpz-"
108#define LIBRPZ_RPZ_PASSTHRU LIBRPZ_RPZ_PREFIX"passthru"
109#define LIBRPZ_RPZ_DROP LIBRPZ_RPZ_PREFIX"drop"
110#define LIBRPZ_RPZ_TCP_ONLY LIBRPZ_RPZ_PREFIX"tcp-only"
111
112
113typedef uint16_t librpz_dznum_t; /* dnsrpzd zone # in [0,DZNUM_MAX] */
114typedef uint8_t librpz_cznum_t; /* client zone # in [0,CZNUM_MAX] */
115
116
117/*
118 * CIDR block
119 */
120typedef struct librpz_prefix {
121 union {
122 struct in_addr in;
123 struct in6_addr in6;
124 } addr;
125 uint8_t family;
126 uint8_t len;
127} librpz_prefix_t;
128
129/*
130 * A domain
131 */
132typedef uint8_t librpz_dsize_t;
133typedef struct librpz_domain {
134 librpz_dsize_t size; /* of only .d */
135 uint8_t d[0]; /* variable length wire format */
136} librpz_domain_t;
137
138/*
139 * A maximal domain buffer
140 */
141typedef struct librpz_domain_buf {
142 librpz_dsize_t size;
143 uint8_t d[NS_MAXCDNAME];
144} librpz_domain_buf_t;
145
146/*
147 * A resource record without the owner name.
148 * C compilers say that sizeof(librpz_rr_t)=12 instead of 10.
149 */
150typedef struct {
151 uint16_t type; /* network byte order */
152 uint16_t class; /* network byte order */
153 uint32_t ttl; /* network byte order */
154 uint16_t rdlength; /* network byte order */
155 uint8_t rdata[0]; /* variable length */
156} librpz_rr_t;
157
158/*
159 * The database file might be mapped with different starting addresses
160 * by concurrent clients (resolvers), and so all pointers are offsets.
161 */
162typedef uint32_t librpz_idx_t;
163#define LIBRPZ_IDX_NULL 0
164#define LIBRPZ_IDX_MIN 1
165#define LIBRPZ_IDX_BAD ((librpz_idx_t)-1)
166/**
167 * Partial decoded results of a set of RPZ queries for a single DNS response
168 * or iteration through the mapped file.
169 */
170typedef int16_t librpz_result_id_t;
171typedef struct librpz_result {
172 librpz_idx_t next_rr;
173 librpz_result_id_t hit_id; /* trigger ID from resolver */
174 librpz_policy_t zpolicy; /* policy from zone */
175 librpz_policy_t policy; /* adjusted by client configuration */
176 librpz_dznum_t dznum; /* dnsrpzd zone number */
177 librpz_cznum_t cznum; /* librpz client zone number */
178 librpz_trig_t trig:LIBRPZ_TRIG_SIZE;
179 bool log:1; /* log rewrite given librpz_log_level */
180} librpz_result_t;
181
182
183/**
184 * librpz trace or log levels.
185 */
186typedef enum {
187 LIBRPZ_LOG_FATAL =0, /* always print fatal errors */
188 LIBRPZ_LOG_ERROR =1, /* errors have this level */
189 LIBRPZ_LOG_TRACE1 =2, /* big events such as dnsrpzd starts */
190 LIBRPZ_LOG_TRACE2 =3, /* smaller dnsrpzd zone transfers */
191 LIBRPZ_LOG_TRACE3 =4, /* librpz hits */
192 LIBRPZ_LOG_TRACE4 =5, /* librpz lookups */
193 LIBRPZ_LOG_INVALID =999,
194} librpz_log_level_t;
195typedef librpz_log_level_t (librpz_log_level_val_t)(librpz_log_level_t level);
196LIBDEF_F(log_level_val)
197
198/**
199 * Logging function that can be supplied by the resolver.
200 * @param level is one of librpz_log_level_t
201 * @param ctx is for use by the resolver's logging system.
202 * NULL mean a context-free message.
203 */
204typedef void(librpz_log_fnc_t)(librpz_log_level_t level, void *ctx,
205 const char *buf);
206
207/**
208 * Point librpz logging functions to the resolver's choice.
209 */
210typedef void (librpz_set_log_t)(librpz_log_fnc_t *new_log, const char *prog_nm);
211LIBDEF_F(set_log)
212
213
214/**
215 * librpz error messages are put in these buffers.
216 * Use a structure instead of naked char* to let the compiler check the length.
217 * A function defined with "foo(char buf[120])" can be called with
218 * "char sbuf[2]; foo(sbuf)" and suffer a buffer overrun.
219 */
220typedef struct {
221 char c[120];
222} librpz_emsg_t;
223
224
225#ifdef LIBRPZ_HAVE_ATTR
226#define LIBRPZ_UNUSED __attribute__((unused))
227#define LIBRPZ_PF(f,l) __attribute__((format(printf,f,l)))
228#define LIBRPZ_NORET __attribute__((__noreturn__))
229#else
230#define LIBRPZ_UNUSED
231#define LIBRPZ_PF(f,l)
232#define LIBRPZ_NORET
233#endif
234
235#ifdef HAVE_BUILTIN_EXPECT
236#define LIBRPZ_LIKELY(c) __builtin_expect(!!(c), 1)
237#define LIBRPZ_UNLIKELY(c) __builtin_expect(!!(c), 0)
238#else
239#define LIBRPZ_LIKELY(c) (c)
240#define LIBRPZ_UNLIKELY(c) (c)
241#endif
242
243typedef bool (librpz_parse_log_opt_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg, const char *arg);
244LIBDEF_F(parse_log_opt)
245
246typedef void (librpz_vpemsg_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg,
247 const char *p, va_list args);
248LIBDEF_F(vpemsg)
249typedef void (librpz_pemsg_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg,
250 const char *p, ...) LIBRPZ_PF(2,3);
251LIBDEF_F(pemsg)
252
253typedef void (librpz_vlog_t)(librpz_log_level_t level, void *ctx,
254 const char *p, va_list args);
255LIBDEF_F(vlog)
256typedef void (librpz_log_t)(librpz_log_level_t level, void *ctx,
257 const char *p, ...) LIBRPZ_PF(3,4);
258LIBDEF_F(log)
259
260typedef void (librpz_fatal_t)(int ex_code,
261 const char *p, ...) LIBRPZ_PF(2,3);
262extern void librpz_fatal(int ex_code,
263 const char *p, ...) LIBRPZ_PF(2,3) LIBRPZ_NORET;
264
265typedef void (librpz_rpz_assert_t)(const char *file, unsigned line,
266 const char *p, ...) LIBRPZ_PF(3,4);
267extern void librpz_rpz_assert(const char *file, unsigned line,
268 const char *p, ...) LIBRPZ_PF(3,4) LIBRPZ_NORET;
269
270typedef void (librpz_rpz_vassert_t)(const char *file, uint line,
271 const char *p, va_list args);
272extern void librpz_rpz_vassert(const char *file, uint line,
273 const char *p, va_list args) LIBRPZ_NORET;
274
275
276/*
277 * As far as clients are concerned, all relative pointers or indexes in a
278 * version of the mapped file except trie node parent pointers remain valid
279 * forever. A client must release a version so that it can be garbage
280 * collected by the file system. When dnsrpzd needs to expand the file,
281 * it copies the old file to a new, larger file. Clients can continue
282 * using the old file.
283 *
284 * Versions can also appear in a single file. Old nodes and trie values
285 * within the file are not destroyed until all clients using the version
286 * that contained the old values release the version.
287 *
288 * A client is marked as using version by connecting to the daemon. It is
289 * marked as using all subsequent versions. A client releases all versions
290 * by closing the connection or a range of versions by updating is slot
291 * in the shared memory version table.
292 *
293 * As far as clients are concerned, there are the following possible librpz
294 * failures:
295 * - malloc() or other fatal internal librpz problems indicated by
296 * a failing return from a librpz function
297 * All operations will fail until client handle is destroyed and
298 * recreated with librpz_client_detach() and librpz_client_create().
299 * - corrupt database detected by librpz code, corrupt database detected
300 * by dnsrpzd, or disconnection from the daemon.
301 * Current operations will fail.
302 *
303 * Clients assume that the file has already been unlinked before
304 * the corrupt flag is set so that they do not race with the server
305 * over the corruption of a single file. A client that finds the
306 * corrupt set knows that dnsrpzd has already crashed with
307 * abort() and is restarting. The client can re-connect to dnsrpzd
308 * and retransmit its configuration, backing off as usual if anything
309 * goes wrong.
310 *
311 * Searches of the database by a client do not need locks against dnsrpzd or
312 * other clients, but a lock is used to protect changes to the connection
313 * by competing threads in the client. The client provides functions
314 * to serialize the concurrent use of any single client handle.
315 * Functions that do nothing are appropriate for applications that are
316 * not "threaded" or that do not share client handles among threads.
317 * Otherwise, functions must be provided to librpz_clientcreate().
318 * Something like the following works with pthreads:
319 *
320 * static void
321 * lock(void *mutex) { assert(pthread_mutex_lock(mutex) == 0); }
322 *
323 * static void
324 * unlock(void *mutex) { assert(pthread_mutex_unlock(mutex) == 0); }
325 *
326 * static void
327 * mutex_destroy(void *mutex) { assert(pthread_mutex_destroy(mutex) == 0); }
328 *
329 *
330 *
331 * At every instant, all of the data and pointers in the mapped file are valid.
332 * Changes to trie node or other data are always made so that it and
333 * all pointers in and to it remain valid for a time. Old versions are
334 * eventually discarded.
335 *
336 * Dnsrpzd periodically defines a new version by setting aside all changes
337 * made since the previous version was defined. Subsequent changes
338 * made (only!) by dnsrpzd will be part of the next version.
339 *
340 * To discard an old version, dnsrpzd must know that all clients have stopped
341 * using that version. Clients do that by using part of the mapped file
342 * to tell dnsrpzd the oldest version that each client is using.
343 * Dnsrpzd assigns each connecting client an entry in the cversions array
344 * in the mapped file. The client puts version numbers into that entry
345 * to signal to dnsrpzd which versions that can be discarded.
346 * Dnsrpzd is free, as far as that client is concerned, to discard all
347 * numerically smaller versions. A client can disclaim all versions with
348 * the version number VERSIONS_ALL or 0.
349 *
350 * The race between a client changing its entry and dnsrpzd discarding a
351 * version is resolved by allowing dnsrpzd to discard all versions
352 * smaller or equal to the client's version number. If dnsrpzd is in
353 * the midst of discarding or about to discard version N when the
354 * client asserts N, no harm is done. The client depends only on
355 * the consistency of version N+1.
356 *
357 * This version mechanism depends in part on not being exercised too frequently
358 * Version numbers are 32 bits long and dnsrpzd creates new versions
359 * at most once every 30 seconds.
360 */
361
362
363/*
364 * Lock functions for concurrent use of a single librpz_client_t client handle.
365 */
366typedef void(librpz_mutex_t)(void *mutex);
367
368/*
369 * List of connections to dnsrpzd daemons.
370 */
371typedef struct librpz_clist librpz_clist_t;
372
373/*
374 * Client's handle on dnsrpzd.
375 */
376typedef struct librpz_client librpz_client_t;
377
378/**
379 * Create the list of connections to the dnsrpzd daemon.
380 * @param[out] emsg: error message
381 * @param lock: start exclusive access to the client handle
382 * @param unlock: end exclusive access to the client handle
383 * @param mutex_destroy: release the lock
384 * @param mutex: pointer to the lock for the client handle
385 * @param log_ctx: NULL or resolver's context log messages
386 */
387typedef librpz_clist_t *(librpz_clist_create_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg,
388 librpz_mutex_t *lock,
389 librpz_mutex_t *unlock,
390 librpz_mutex_t *mutex_destroy,
391 void *mutex, void *log_ctx);
392LIBDEF_F(clist_create)
393
394
395/**
396 * Release the list of dnsrpzd connections.
397 */
398typedef void (librpz_clist_detach_t)(librpz_clist_t **clistp);
399LIBDEF_F(clist_detach)
400
401/**
402 * Create a librpz client handle.
403 * @param[out] emsg: error message
404 * @param clist: of dnsrpzd connections
405 * @param cstr: string of configuration settings separated by ';' or '\n'
406 * @param use_expired: true to not ignore expired zones
407 * @return client handle or NULL if the handle could not be created
408 */
409typedef librpz_client_t *(librpz_client_create_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg,
410 librpz_clist_t *clist,
411 const char *cstr,
412 bool use_expired);
413LIBDEF_F(client_create)
414
415/**
416 * Start (if necessary) dnsrpzd and connect to it.
417 * @param[out] emsg: error message
418 * @param client handle
419 * @param optional: true if it is ok if starting the daemon is not allowed
420 */
421typedef bool (librpz_connect_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg, librpz_client_t *client,
422 bool optional);
423LIBDEF_F(connect)
424
425/**
426 * Start to destroy a librpz client handle.
427 * It will not be destroyed until the last set of RPZ queries represented
428 * by a librpz_rsp_t ends.
429 * @param client handle to be released
430 * @return false on error
431 */
432typedef void (librpz_client_detach_t)(librpz_client_t **clientp);
433LIBDEF_F(client_detach)
434
435/**
436 * State for a set of RPZ queries for a single DNS response
437 * or for listing the database.
438 */
439typedef struct librpz_rsp librpz_rsp_t;
440
441/**
442 * Start a set of RPZ queries for a single DNS response.
443 * @param[out] emsg: error message for false return or *rspp=NULL
444 * @param[out] rspp created context or NULL
445 * @param[out] min_ns_dotsp: NULL or pointer to configured MIN-NS-DOTS value
446 * @param client state
447 * @param have_rd: RD=1 in the DNS request
448 * @param have_do: DO=1 in the DNS request
449 * @return false on error
450 */
451typedef bool (librpz_rsp_create_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg, librpz_rsp_t **rspp,
452 int *min_ns_dotsp, librpz_client_t *client,
453 bool have_rd, bool have_do);
454LIBDEF_F(rsp_create)
455
456/**
457 * Finish RPZ work for a DNS response.
458 */
459typedef void (librpz_rsp_detach_t)(librpz_rsp_t **rspp);
460LIBDEF_F(rsp_detach)
461
462/**
463 * Get the final, accumulated result of a set of RPZ queries.
464 * Yield LIBRPZ_POLICY_UNDEFINED if
465 * - there were no hits,
466 * - there was a dispositive hit, be we have not recursed and are required
467 * to recurse so that evil DNS authorities will not know we are using RPZ
468 * - we have a hit and have recursed, but later data such as NSIP could
469 * override
470 * @param[out] emsg
471 * @param[out] result describes the hit
472 * or result->policy=LIBRPZ_POLICY_UNDEFINED without a hit
473 * @param[out] result: current policy rewrite values
474 * @param recursed: recursion has now been done even if it was not done
475 * when the hit was found
476 * @param[in,out] rsp state from librpz_itr_start()
477 * @return false on error
478 */
479typedef bool (librpz_rsp_result_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg, librpz_result_t *result,
480 bool recursed, const librpz_rsp_t *rsp);
481LIBDEF_F(rsp_result)
482
483/**
484 * Might looking for a trigger be worthwhile?
485 * @param trig: look for this type of trigger
486 * @param ipv6: true if trig is LIBRPZ_TRIG_CLIENT_IP, LIBRPZ_TRIG_IP,
487 * or LIBRPZ_TRIG_NSIP and the IP address is IPv6
488 * @return: true if looking could be worthwhile
489 */
490typedef bool (librpz_have_trig_t)(librpz_trig_t trig, bool ipv6,
491 const librpz_rsp_t *rsp);
492LIBDEF_F(have_trig)
493
494/**
495 * Might looking for NSDNAME and NSIP triggers be worthwhile?
496 * @return: true if looking could be worthwhile
497 */
498typedef bool (librpz_have_ns_trig_t)(const librpz_rsp_t *rsp);
499LIBDEF_F(have_ns_trig)
500
501/**
502 * Convert the found client IP trie key to a CIDR block
503 * @param[out] emsg
504 * @param[out] prefix trigger
505 * @param[in,out] rsp state from librpz_itr_start()
506 * @return false on error
507 */
508typedef bool (librpz_rsp_clientip_prefix_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg,
509 librpz_prefix_t *prefix,
510 librpz_rsp_t *rsp);
511LIBDEF_F(rsp_clientip_prefix)
512
513/**
514 * Compute the owner name of the found or result trie key, usually to log it.
515 * An IP address key might be returned as 8.0.0.0.127.rpz-client-ip.
516 * example.com. might be a qname trigger. example.com.rpz-nsdname. could
517 * be an NSDNAME trigger.
518 * @param[out] emsg
519 * @param[out] owner domain
520 * @param[in,out] rsp state from librpz_itr_start()
521 * @return false on error
522 */
523typedef bool (librpz_rsp_domain_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg,
524 librpz_domain_buf_t *owner,
525 librpz_rsp_t *rsp);
526LIBDEF_F(rsp_domain)
527
528/**
529 * Get the next RR of the LIBRPZ_POLICY_RECORD result after an initial use of
530 * librpz_rsp_result() or librpz_itr_node() or after a previous use of
531 * librpz_rsp_rr(). The RR is in uncompressed wire format including type,
532 * class, ttl and length in network byte order.
533 * @param[out] emsg
534 * @param[out] typep: optional host byte order record type or ns_t_invalid (0)
535 * @param[out] classp: class such as ns_c_in
536 * @param[out] ttlp: TTL
537 * @param[out] rrp: optional malloc() buffer containing the next RR or
538 * NULL after the last RR
539 * @param[out] result: current policy rewrite values
540 * @param qname: used construct a wildcard CNAME
541 * @param qname_size
542 * @param[in,out] rsp state from librpz_itr_start()
543 * @return false on error
544 */
545typedef bool (librpz_rsp_rr_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg, uint16_t *typep,
546 uint16_t *classp, uint32_t *ttlp,
547 librpz_rr_t **rrp, librpz_result_t *result,
548 const uint8_t *qname, size_t qname_size,
549 librpz_rsp_t *rsp);
550LIBDEF_F(rsp_rr)
551
552/**
553 * Get the next RR of the LIBRPZ_POLICY_RECORD result.
554 * @param[out] emsg
555 * @param[out] ttlp: TTL
556 * @param[out] rrp: malloc() buffer with SOA RR without owner name
557 * @param[out] result: current policy rewrite values
558 * @param[out] origin: SOA owner name
559 * @param[out] origin_size
560 * @param[in,out] rsp state from librpz_itr_start()
561 * @return false on error
562 */
563typedef bool (librpz_rsp_soa_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg, uint32_t *ttlp,
564 librpz_rr_t **rrp, librpz_domain_buf_t *origin,
565 librpz_result_t *result, librpz_rsp_t *rsp);
566LIBDEF_F(rsp_soa)
567
568/**
569 * Get the SOA serial number for a policy zone to compare with a known value
570 * to check whether a zone transfer is complete.
571 */
572typedef bool (librpz_soa_serial_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg, uint32_t *serialp,
573 const char *domain_nm, librpz_rsp_t *rsp);
574LIBDEF_F(soa_serial)
575
576/**
577 * Save the current policy checking state.
578 * @param[out] emsg
579 * @param[in,out] rsp state from librpz_itr_start()
580 * @return false on error
581 */
582typedef bool (librpz_rsp_push_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg, librpz_rsp_t *rsp);
583LIBDEF_F(rsp_push)
584#define LIBRPZ_RSP_STACK_DEPTH 3
585
586/**
587 * Restore the previous policy checking state.
588 * @param[out] emsg
589 * @param[out] result: NULL or restored policy rewrite values
590 * @param[in,out] rsp state from librpz_itr_start()
591 * @return false on error
592 */
593typedef bool (librpz_rsp_pop_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg, librpz_result_t *result,
594 librpz_rsp_t *rsp);
595LIBDEF_F(rsp_pop)
596
597/**
598 * Discard the most recently save policy checking state.
599 * @param[out] emsg
600 * @param[out] result: NULL or restored policy rewrite values
601 * @return false on error
602 */
603typedef bool (librpz_rsp_pop_discard_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg, librpz_rsp_t *rsp);
604LIBDEF_F(rsp_pop_discard)
605

607 * Disable a zone.

609 * @param znum
610 * @param[in,out] rsp state from librpz_itr_start()
611 * @return false on error

613typedef bool (librpz_rsp_forget_zone_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg,
614 librpz_cznum_t znum, librpz_rsp_t *rsp);
615LIBDEF_F(rsp_forget_zone)
616
617/**
618 * Apply RPZ to an IP address.
619 * @param[out] emsg
620 * @param addr: address to check
621 * @param ipv6: true for 16 byte IPv6 instead of 4 byte IPv4
622 * @param trig LIBRPZ_TRIG_CLIENT_IP, LIBRPZ_TRIG_IP, or LIBRPZ_TRIG_NSIP
623 * @param hit_id: caller chosen
624 * @param recursed: recursion has been done
625 * @param[in,out] rsp state from librpz_itr_start()
626 * @return false on error
627 */
628typedef bool (librpz_ck_ip_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg,
629 const void *addr, uint family,
630 librpz_trig_t trig, librpz_result_id_t hit_id,
631 bool recursed, librpz_rsp_t *rsp);
632LIBDEF_F(ck_ip)
633
634/**
635 * Apply RPZ to a wire-format domain.
636 * @param[out] emsg
637 * @param domain in wire format
638 * @param domain_size
639 * @param trig LIBRPZ_TRIG_QNAME or LIBRPZ_TRIG_NSDNAME
640 * @param hit_id: caller chosen
641 * @param recursed: recursion has been done
642 * @param[in,out] rsp state from librpz_itr_start()
643 * @return false on error
644 */
645typedef bool (librpz_ck_domain_t)(librpz_emsg_t *emsg,
646 const uint8_t *domain, size_t domain_size,
647 librpz_trig_t trig, librpz_result_id_t hit_id,
648 bool recursed, librpz_rsp_t *rsp);
649LIBDEF_F(ck_domain)
650
651/**
652 * Ask dnsrpzd to refresh a zone.
653 * @param[out] emsg error message

660LIBDEF_F(zone_refresh)

662/**
663 * Get a string describing the database

796/**
797 * default path to dnsrpzd

799const char *librpz_dnsrpzd_path;

802#undef LIBDEF
803
804/*
805 * This is the dlopen() interface to librpz.
806 */
807typedef const struct {
808 const char *dnsrpzd_path;
809 const char *version;
810 librpz_parse_log_opt_t *parse_log_opt;
811 librpz_log_level_val_t *log_level_val;
812 librpz_set_log_t *set_log;
813 librpz_vpemsg_t *vpemsg;
814 librpz_pemsg_t *pemsg;
815 librpz_vlog_t *vlog;
816 librpz_log_t *log;
817 librpz_fatal_t *fatal LIBRPZ_NORET;
818 librpz_rpz_assert_t *rpz_assert LIBRPZ_NORET;
819 librpz_rpz_vassert_t *rpz_vassert LIBRPZ_NORET;
820 librpz_clist_create_t *clist_create;
821 librpz_clist_detach_t *clist_detach;
822 librpz_client_create_t *client_create;
823 librpz_connect_t *connect;
824 librpz_client_detach_t *client_detach;
825 librpz_rsp_create_t *rsp_create;
826 librpz_rsp_detach_t *rsp_detach;
827 librpz_rsp_result_t *rsp_result;
828 librpz_have_trig_t *have_trig;
829 librpz_have_ns_trig_t *have_ns_trig;
830 librpz_rsp_clientip_prefix_t *rsp_clientip_prefix;
831 librpz_rsp_domain_t *rsp_domain;
832 librpz_rsp_rr_t *rsp_rr;
833 librpz_rsp_soa_t *rsp_soa;
834 librpz_soa_serial_t *soa_serial;
835 librpz_rsp_push_t *rsp_push;
836 librpz_rsp_pop_t *rsp_pop;
837 librpz_rsp_pop_discard_t *rsp_pop_discard;
838 librpz_rsp_forget_zone_t *rsp_forget_zone;
839 librpz_ck_ip_t *ck_ip;
840 librpz_ck_domain_t *ck_domain;
841 librpz_zone_refresh_t *zone_refresh;
842 librpz_db_info_t *db_info;
843 librpz_itr_start_t *itr_start;
844 librpz_mf_stats_t *mf_stats;
845 librpz_vers_stats_t *vers_stats;
846 librpz_itr_zone_t *itr_zone;
847 librpz_itr_node_t *itr_node;
848 librpz_policy2str_t *policy2str;
849 librpz_trig2str_t *trig2str;
850 librpz_secs2str_t *secs2str;
851 librpz_str2secs_t *str2secs;
852 librpz_rtype2str_t *rtype2str;
853 librpz_domain_ntop_t *domain_ntop;
854 librpz_domain_pton2_t *domain_pton2;
855 librpz_mk_inet_su_t *mk_inet_su;
856 librpz_mk_inet6_su_t *mk_inet6_su;
857 librpz_str2su_t *str2su;
858 librpz_su2str_t *su2str;
859} librpz_0_t;
860extern librpz_0_t librpz_def_0;
861
862/*
863 * Future versions can be upward compatible by defining LIBRPZ_DEF as
864 * librpz_X_t.
865 */
866#define LIBRPZ_DEF librpz_def_0
867#define LIBRPZ_DEF_STR "librpz_def_0"
868
869typedef librpz_0_t librpz_t;
870extern librpz_t *librpz;
871
872
873#if LIBRPZ_LIB_OPEN == 2
874#include <dlfcn.h>
875
876/**
877 * link-load librpz
878 * @param[out] emsg: error message
879 * @param[in,out] dl_handle: NULL or pointer to new dlopen handle
880 * @param[in] path: librpz.so path
881 * @return address of interface structure or NULL on failure
882 */
883static inline librpz_t *
884librpz_lib_open(librpz_emsg_t *emsg, void **dl_handle, const char *path)
885{
886 void *handle;
887 librpz_t *new_librpz;
888
889 emsg->c[0] = '\0';
890
891 /*
892 * Close a previously opened handle on librpz.so.
893 */
894 if (dl_handle != NULL && *dl_handle != NULL) {
895 if (dlclose(*dl_handle) != 0) {
896 snprintf(emsg->c, sizeof(librpz_emsg_t),
897 "dlopen(NULL): %s", dlerror());
898 return (NULL);
899 }
900 *dl_handle = NULL;
901 }
902
903 /*
904 * First try the main executable of the process in case it was
905 * linked to librpz.
906 * Do not worry if we cannot search the main executable of the process.
907 */
908 handle = dlopen(NULL, RTLD_NOW | RTLD_LOCAL);
909 if (handle != NULL) {
910 new_librpz = dlsym(handle, LIBRPZ_DEF_STR);
911 if (new_librpz != NULL) {
912 if (dl_handle != NULL)
913 *dl_handle = handle;
914 return (new_librpz);
915 }
916 if (dlclose(handle) != 0) {
917 snprintf(emsg->c, sizeof(librpz_emsg_t),
918 "dlsym(NULL, "LIBRPZ_DEF_STR"): %s",
919 dlerror());
920 return (NULL);
921 }
922 }
923
924 if (path == NULL || path[0] == '\0') {
925 snprintf(emsg->c, sizeof(librpz_emsg_t),
926 "librpz not linked and no dlopen() path provided");
927 return (NULL);
928 }
929
930 handle = dlopen(path, RTLD_NOW | RTLD_LOCAL);
931 if (handle == NULL) {
932 snprintf(emsg->c, sizeof(librpz_emsg_t), "dlopen(%s): %s",
933 path, dlerror());
934 return (NULL);
935 }
936 new_librpz = dlsym(handle, LIBRPZ_DEF_STR);
937 if (new_librpz != NULL) {
938 if (dl_handle != NULL)
939 *dl_handle = handle;
940 return (new_librpz);
941 }
942 snprintf(emsg->c, sizeof(librpz_emsg_t),
943 "dlsym(%s, "LIBRPZ_DEF_STR"): %s",
944 path, dlerror());
945 dlclose(handle);
946 return (NULL);
947}
948#elif defined(LIBRPZ_LIB_OPEN)
949/*
950 * Statically link to the librpz.so DSO on systems without dlopen()
951 */
952static inline librpz_t *
953librpz_lib_open(librpz_emsg_t *emsg, void **dl_handle, const char *path)
954{
955 (void)(path);
956
957 if (dl_handle != NULL)
958 *dl_handle = NULL;
959
960#if LIBRPZ_LIB_OPEN == 1
961 emsg->c[0] = '\0';
962 return (&LIBRPZ_DEF);
963#else
964 snprintf(emsg->c, sizeof(librpz_emsg_t),
965 "librpz not available via ./configure");
966 return (NULL);
967#endif /* LIBRPZ_LIB_OPEN */
968}
969#endif /* LIBRPZ_LIB_OPEN */
970
971#endif /* LIBRPZ_H */
972
